situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The ant is two months old. The bear disarms the dachshund. The crow brings an oil tank for the rhino. The dachshund is named Casper. The german shepherd has 2 friends, and is watching a movie from 1966. The german shepherd is a farm worker. The swan is named Charlie. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: One of the rules of the game is that if the bear disarms the dachshund, then the dachshund will never suspect the truthfulness of the basenji. Rule2: If there is evidence that one animal, no matter which one, brings an oil tank for the rhino, then the ant reveals a secret to the basenji undoubtedly. Rule3: If the german shepherd works in education, then the german shepherd does not leave the houses that are occupied by the dalmatian. Rule4: Regarding the ant, if it is less than three and a half years old, then we can conclude that it does not reveal a secret to the basenji. Rule5: If at least one animal leaves the houses occupied by the dalmatian, then the basenji does not swear to the mannikin. Rule6: Regarding the german shepherd, if it is watching a movie that was released before the first man landed on moon, then we can conclude that it does not leave the houses occupied by the dalmatian. Rule7: Regarding the german shepherd, if it has fewer than five friends, then we can conclude that it leaves the houses occupied by the dalmatian. Rule2 is preferred over Rule4. Rule7 is preferred over Rule3. Rule7 is preferred over Rule6.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the basenji swear to the mannikin?
label: disproved
